intro: Uragoga guerzeensis, commonly known as the Guerzeensis uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it a valuable subject for research in plant adaptation and biodiversity.
